name: 優選理論
description: 本課程介紹一般最佳化問題的結構，並簡介最佳題解的優選條件與相關演算法。
goals: 瞭解一般最佳化問題的理論背景
瞭解一般最佳化問題的實際應用
syllabus:
16+2 周方式進行。

**Office Hours** 

You are welcomed to drop by my office whenever I am in  my office (I am almost available in the morning of weekdays)  or please feel free to make an appointment with me.

**Textbook** 

No textbook is required, some lectures notes will be handed out.  You are also expected to take class notes on your own.  Here are two references:

 1. The Mathematics of Nonlinear Programming, by A. Peressini, F. Sullivan and J. Uhl, Springer-Verlag, 1988.  

2\. An Introduction to Optimization, 4th edition, by E. Chong and S. Zak, Wiley, 2013.  

**Homework** 

As you are probably aware, most learning in a math course takes place  when you do your homework. I will assign biweekly homework for  your practice. 

**Exam** 

There are no in-class exams. I will ask everyone to have a  30-minutes presentation whose topic is up to your choice (anything  related to optimization is fine) at the end of the semester which  is counted as the final. More details will be announced when it  is approaching.

**Grades** 

Your final grade for this course will be determined as follows:  

Homework  30 %     

Attendance  30 %       

Final             40 %   

Sometimes you will be asked to attend conferences or workshops related to this  course, and attendance of such cases is also counted.

**Topics**

Mathematical Preliminaries      

      Vector space and Matrices         

      Differentiation in R^n       

Convex Sets and Cones       

      Convex sets       

      Separation Theorems        

      Convex cones       

Convex Functions       

      Characterizations of convex functions         

      Conjugate and support functions       

Unconstrained Minimization         

      Sufficient and necessary conditions     

      Least squares minimization       

      Linear system $Ax=b$       

Iterative Gradient Methods       

      Rules for stepsize       

      Steepest descent method       

      Newton methods       

      Quasi-Newton methods       

Conjugate Gradient Method and Trust Region Method       

      Conjugate gradient method       

      Trust region method     

Constrained Minimization

       KKT conditions

       Penaly method

       Barrier method
